prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a long, thin, metallic object with a cylindrical base and a pointed tip. This object has a rectangular cross-section and is slightly tapered towards the ends. Creating the Coordinate System 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.1312, 0.0] Drawing the 2D Sketch 2. Begin a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. 3. Draw the first face with two loops: - Loop 1: 1. Draw line 1 from (0.0375, 0.0) to (0.7125, 0.0). 2. Draw arc 1 from (0.7125, 0.0) to (0.7125, 0.075) with a midpoint at (0.675, 0.0375). 3. Draw line 2 from (0.7125, 0.075) to (0.0381, 0.075). 4. Draw arc 2 from (0.0381, 0.075) to (0.0375, 0.0) with a midpoint at (0.0, 0.0378). - Loop 2: 1. Draw line 1 from (0.0375, 0.0094) to (0.7125, 0.0094). 2. Draw arc 1 from (0.7125, 0.0094) to (0.7125, 0.0656) with a midpoint at (0.6844, 0.0375). 3. Draw line 2 from (0.7125, 0.0656) to (0.0381, 0.0656). 4. Draw arc 2 from (0.0381, 0.0656) to (0.0375, 0.0094) with a midpoint at (0.0094, 0.0378). Scaling the 2D Sketch 4. Scale the 2D sketch using a factor of 0.7125. Transforming the 2D Sketch into a 3D Sketch 5. Apply the following transformation properties to the scaled 2D sketch to create a 3D sketch: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.1312, 0.0] Extruding the 3D Model 6. Set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0.1312 and the extrusion depth opposite the normal to 0.0. Use the scaled sketch_scale (0.7125) for scaling, and select the 'New Body Feature Operation' as the operation. At this point, the first part should match the description in the JSON. You can check the dimensions, shape, and other details provided in the JSON.</description>

<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.1312,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0375,0.0],"End Point":[0.7125,0.0]},"arc_1":{"Start Point":[0.7125,0.0],"Mid Point":[0.675,0.0375],"End Point":[0.7125,0.075]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.7125,0.075],"End Point":[0.0381,0.075]},"arc_2":{"Start Point":[0.0381,0.075],"Mid Point":[0.0,0.0378],"End Point":[0.0375,0.0]}},"loop_2":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0375,0.0094],"End Point":[0.7125,0.0094]},"arc_1":{"Start Point":[0.7125,0.0094],"Mid Point":[0.6844,0.0375],"End Point":[0.7125,0.0656]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.7125,0.0656],"End Point":[0.0381,0.0656]},"arc_2":{"Start Point":[0.0381,0.0656],"Mid Point":[0.0094,0.0378],"End Point":[0.0375,0.0094]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.1312,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.7125,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

Draw five lines on the sketch as follows: - Line 1: Start Point - (0.0, 0.0744), End Point - (0.0853, 0.0) - Line 2: Start Point - (0.0853, 0.0), End Point - (0.1695, 0.0416) - Line 3: Start Point - (0.1695, 0.0416), End Point - (0.1312, 0.1651) - Line 4: Start Point - (0.1312, 0.1651), End Point - (0.0755, 0.1651) - Line 5: Start Point - (0.0755, 0.1651), End Point - (0.0, 0.0744) 4.
